text:
getLocale()/getLocales() do not work properly given an Accept-Language header 
with multiple entries from an IE5 client.  Except for number of entries n=1 or 
n=3, getLocale() returns the second priority entry rather than the first.  
getLocales() similarly rearranges the enumeration, placing the highest priority 
in second place, and swapping other subsequences of priorities in a curious 
pattern.

This is not observed with Netscape 4.7 client.  One possible difference is IE's 
use of qualifier values, not used by Netscape.
creator: chjohnson@vignette.com
nacho@apache.org
text:
Fixed on Tomcat 3.2 and up.
Fixed on Tomcat 3.3.
